bibl.note: This document is a legal petition signed by the citizens of Bedford County, Tennessee. The petition asks for a clause to be entered into the state Constitution that will emancipate all of the slaves held in Tennessee by the year 1866. Both slaveholding and non-slaveholding citizens signed the petition.
Memorial to the Honorable Convention of the State of Tennessee

div1.head: MEMORIAL
To the Honorable Convention of the State of Tennessee, to convene in Nashville in May next.
div1.p: from Bedford CoWE your humble Petitioners knowing the evil of SLAVERY, and believing that our State has, and yet continues to labour under disadvantages, which cannot be remedied while Slavery is tolerated by her laws, pray your Honorable Body, to insert a clause in the revized or amended Constitution of this State, affecting the gradual emancipation of Slaves, so that it shall be a free state against the year 1866.
2d. And make it the duty of the Legislature to Colonize them, when they are emancipated and we your petitioners, as in duty bound, will ever pray.
